awd_abstract_narration: The Department of Mathematics and Statistics at Utah State                 University will enhance the capabilities of an existing                         workstation system by purchasing a CPU upgrade, network co-                     processing board, network traffic software, larger disks, and                   peripheral video I/O equipment at an estimated cost of $53,014 to               allow researchers to better visualize the results of their work                 by significantly increasing the performance of the existing                     system.  The equipment will be used for the following research                  projects.                                                                                                                                                            1. Physically Based Stochastic Models of Fracture                                  and Fluid Flow in Rock (K. Hestir and J. Koebbe)                                                                                                             2. Pore-Dispersion and Homogenization (J. Koebbe)                                                                                                               3. Dynamical Pulse Behavior at Nonlinear Boundaries                                (J. Powell)                                                                                                                                                  4. Newton Iterative Methods for Large Scale                                        Nonlinear Systems (H. Walker)
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
